intro: Echinocactus candidus, commonly known as the white hedgehog cactus, is a species of cactus native to Mexico. It is characterized by its cylindrical stems covered in white, woolly spines. The plant produces yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires minimal water, making it suitable for arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and hardy nature, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant.
